intro: Campylospermum warneckei, commonly known as the Warneckei's campylospermum, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
